exceptions.exn: In environment factorial_cancel : forall n a b : nat, fact n * a = fact n * b -> a = b p : nat Hp : p <> 0 expo_p_cancel : forall n a b : nat, expo n p * a = expo n p * b -> a = b phi_Zp_eq : forall n r : nat, 〚 φ n r 〛 = 〚 fact r 〛 Psi_Zp_eq : forall n : nat, 〚 Ψ n 〛 = expoZp n 〚 fact (p - 1) 〛 Hprime : prime p phi_Zp_invertible : forall n r : nat, r < p -> Zp_invertible Hp 〚 φ n r 〛 Psi_Zp_invertible : forall n : nat, Zp_invertible Hp 〚 Ψ n 〛 n, N, n0, k, K, k0 : nat Hn : n = N * p + n0 Hk : k = K * p + k0 H1 : K < N H2 : n0 < k0 Hk0 : k0 < p Unable to unify "k0 < p" with "k0 - n0 <= p".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
factorial_cancel: forall n a b : nat, fact n * a = fact n * b -> a = b
p: nat
Hp: p <> 0
expo_p_cancel: forall n a b : nat, expo n p * a = expo n p * b -> a = b
phi_Zp_eq: forall n r : nat, 〚 φ n r 〛 = 〚 fact r 〛
Psi_Zp_eq: forall n : nat, 〚 Ψ n 〛 = expoZp n 〚 fact (p - 1) 〛
Hprime: prime p
phi_Zp_invertible: forall n r : nat, r < p -> Zp_invertible Hp 〚 φ n r 〛
Psi_Zp_invertible: forall n : nat, Zp_invertible Hp 〚 Ψ n 〛
k0: nat
K: nat
k: nat
n0: nat
N: nat
n: nat
Hn: n = N * p + n0
Hk: k = K * p + k0
H1: K < N
H2: n0 < k0
Hk0: k0 < p

Goal:
p - (k0 - n0) < p

Premises:
Notation expo := power
prime = fun p : nat => p <> 1 /\ (forall q : nat, divides q p -> q = 1 \/ q = p) : nat -> Prop Arguments prime _%nat_scope
fact = fix fact (n : nat) : nat := match n with | 0 => 1 | S n0 => S n0 * fact n0 end : nat -> nat Arguments fact _%nat_scope
Zp_invertible : forall p : nat, p <> 0 -> Z_Zp p -> Prop
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
Notation expoZp := (mscal (Zp_mult Hp) Op)

div_prop : forall q p n r : nat, q = n * p + r -> r < p -> div q p = n
mprod_factorial_Zp : forall i n : nat, 〚 Π n (fun i0 : nat => i0 + (i * p + 1)) 〛 = 〚 fact n 〛
mprod_factorial_euclid : forall n r : nat, fact (n * p + r) = expo n p * fact n * Π r (fun i : nat => i + (n * p + 1)) * Π n (fun i : nat => Π (p - 1) (fun i0 : nat => i0 + (i * p + 1)))
bezout_rel_prime_lt : forall p q : nat, 0 < p < q -> is_gcd p q 1 -> {a : nat & {b : nat | a * p + b * q = 1 + p * q /\ a <= q /\ b <= p}}
Newton_nat : forall a b n : nat, expo n (a + b) = msum add 0 (S n) (fun i : nat => binomial n i * expo (n - i) a * expo i b)
binomial_wo_p : forall n N n0 k K k0 : nat, n = N * p + n0 -> k = K * p + k0 -> K <= N -> k0 <= n0 -> Π k0 (fun i : nat => i + (K * p + 1)) * Π K (fun i : nat => Π (p - 1) (fun i0 : nat => i0 + (i * p + 1))) * Π (n0 - k0) (fun i : nat => i + ((N - K) * p + 1)) * Π (N - K) (fun i : nat => Π (p - 1) (fun i0 : nat => i0 + (i * p + 1))) * binomial n k = binomial N K * Π n0 (fun i : nat => i + (N * p + 1)) * Π N (fun i : nat => Π (p - 1) (fun i0 : nat => i0 + (i * p + 1)))
power_plus : forall p a b : nat, expo (a + b) p = expo a p * expo b p
mprod_factorial_mult : forall n : nat, fact (n * p) = expo n p * fact n * Π n (fun i : nat => Π (p - 1) (fun i0 : nat => i0 + (i * p + 1)))
is_digit = fun c q i y : nat => y < q /\ (exists a b : nat, c = (a * q + y) * expo i q + b /\ b < expo i q) : nat -> nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments is_digit (_ _ _ _)%nat_scope
binomial_spec : forall n p : nat, p <= n -> fact n = binomial n p * fact p * fact (n - p)
binomial_thm : forall n p : nat, p <= n -> fact n = binomial n p * fact p * fact (n - p)
plus_cancel_l : forall a b c : nat, a + b = a + c -> b = c
bezout_sc : forall p q a b m : nat, a * p + b * q = 1 + m -> divides p m \/ divides q m -> is_gcd p q 1
rem_lt : forall p : nat, p <> 0 -> forall a : nat, a < p -> rem a p = a
rem_plus_div : forall p : nat, p <> 0 -> forall a b : nat, divides p b -> rem a p = rem (a + b) p
binomial_le : forall n p : nat, p <= n -> binomial n p = div (fact n) (fact p * fact (n - p))
Zp_invert_stable : forall (p : nat) (Hp : p <> 0) (Hp' : prime p) (n : nat), 1 < n < p - 1 -> exists m : nat, 1 < m < p - 1 /\ nat2Zp Hp m = Zp_invert Hp Hp' (nat2Zp Hp n)
Newton_nat_S : forall a n : nat, expo n (1 + a) = msum add 0 (S n) (fun i : nat => binomial n i * expo i a)
nat2Zp_invertible_prime : forall (p : nat) (Hp : p <> 0), prime p -> forall n : nat, 0 < n < p -> Zp_invertible Hp (nat2Zp Hp n)
fact_S : forall n : nat, fact (S n) = S n * fact n
utils_list.list_an_spec : forall a n m : nat, In m (utils_list.list_an a n) < -> a <= m < a + n
binomial_Newton : forall (X : Type) (sum times : X -> X -> X) (zero one : X), monoid_theory sum zero -> (forall x y : X, sum x y = sum y x) -> (forall x u v : X, sum x u = sum x v -> u = v) -> monoid_theory times one -> (forall x y z : X, times x (sum y z) = sum (times x y) (times x z)) -> (forall x y z : X, times (sum y z) x = sum (times y x) (times z x)) -> forall (n : nat) (a b : X), times a b = times b a -> mscal times one n (sum a b) = msum sum zero (S n) (fun i : nat => mscal sum zero (binomial n i) (times (mscal times one (n - i) a) (mscal times one i b)))
sum_power_lt : forall (k n : nat) (f : nat -> nat), k <> 0 -> (forall i : nat, i < n -> f i < k) -> msum add 0 n (fun i : nat => f i * expo i k) < expo n k
